title: Comparative Analysis of U.S. and European e-Learning Design: Customized Courses for Professional Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic job experience in medical/legal/technical fields and possession of digital literacy
context.additional_context: Social sector job training conducted in smartphone-centric limited environments, emphasizing e-learning design strategies applicable to field settings

learning_goals: Learners can compare three major educational philosophies in U.S. and European e-learning design traditions
Learners analyze how regional learning theories (e.g., constructivism vs. objectivism) influence e-learning design
Learners design two innovative instructional strategies suitable for smartphone-based blended learning environments
Formative assessment tools (quizzes, feedback surveys) are utilized at 80% or higher when evaluating e-learning content

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
